_comment: This is a placeholder hooks configuration. Hooks are currently disabled to keep development simple during MVP phase. When ready to add automation, uncomment and customize the examples below.

auto_format_after_edit.description: Automatically format TypeScript files after editing

hooks.command: if [[ "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" =~ \.(ts|tsx)$ ]]; then bunx prettier --write "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" 2>/dev/null || true; fi

block_dangerous_commands.description: Block dangerous bash commands like rm -rf or force push

hooks.command: if [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_INPUT" == *"rm -rf"* ]] || [[ "$CLAUDE_TOOL_INPUT" == *"force"*"push"* ]]; then echo 'BLOCKED: Dangerous command detected' && exit 2; fi

run_tests_after_edit.description: Run tests after editing test files (requires testing framework setup)

hooks.command: if [[ "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" =~ \.test\.(ts|tsx)$ ]]; then bun test "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" 2>/dev/null || true; fi

typecheck_on_edit.description: Run TypeScript type checking after editing TS files

hooks.command: if [[ "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" =~ \.(ts|tsx)$ ]]; then bunx tsc --noEmit 2>&1 | head -20 || true; fi
if [[ "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATHS" == *".env"* ]]; then echo 'WARNING: Editing .env file - ensure no secrets are exposed' && exit 1; fi

_documentation.purpose: Hooks allow automated validation, formatting, and safety checks during development
when_to_enable: When you want automatic code formatting (Prettier)
When you want safety guards (block dangerous commands)
When you want automatic testing after edits
When you have established patterns to enforce
_documentation.how_to_enable: Copy examples from _examples into the appropriate hook array (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, etc.)
environment_variables: $CLAUDE_TOOL_INPUT - Full input to the tool being called
$CLAUDE_TOOL_NAME - Name of the tool being used
